customfield_22854.value: 1. Exit strategy will be put in place, but which one is not known at this time

fields.customfield_16311:
1. Refer to the Static URL rollback procedure in https://thehub.thomsonreuters.com/docs/DOC-849938.
2. Refer to the DML rollback procedure in the 'DML Updates' section above.
3. Restore back up of previous CMDB state.
4. Deploy the Previous release set through the deploy tool.
IF PRE-PROD: http://uberdeployer.int.thomsonreuters.com OR
IF PROD: http://prod-uberdeployer.int.thomsonreuters.com
5. Run the smoke tests for the previous version of the application.
fields.customfield_16307:
# Create a backup of the current CMDB state.
# Record the current tag version of the BDD smoke tests in Jenkins (for rollback)
fields.customfield_16306:
{LIST OUT THE STEPS REQUIRED TO PERFORM THIS RELEASE - ADD TO/REMOVE FROM THE BELOW LIST AS REQUIRED. 
MAKE SURE TO SUBSTITUTE IN THE RELEVANT {fsp-controller.version} FOR THE CURRENT RELEASE SET}

# If DDL:
## Raise required DCO change tickets for schema changes,
## Await confirmation that the DCO have actioned the schema changes.
# If DML:
## Apply the DML database updates detailed on the DML field above
# If CMDB:
# Apply the CMDB updates
# Deploy the release set through the deploy tool
## IF PRE-PROD: http://uberdeployer.int.thomsonreuters.com OR
## IF PROD: http://prod-uberdeployer.int.thomsonreuters.com
# Run the smoke tests during the application deployment.
# To update the static URL follow the steps in this document https://thehub.thomsonreuters.com/docs/DOC-849938
fields.customfield_16305:
Execute DDL SQL after {x.x.x} from the directory - https://github.complinet.com/grc/accelus-security/tree/accelus-security-{x.x.x}/security-service/security-service-rest/src/main/sql/released

Execute DDL SQL after {x.x.x} from the directory - https://github.complinet.com/grc/fsp-casemanager/tree/casemanager-{x.x.x}/casemanager-service/casemanager-service-ui/src/main/sql/released
fields.customfield_16045:
{Operational Changes or one time operational procedures.

Operational changes are defined as:-
New applications
Move of functionality to new modules
New queues
New endpoints
New modules or jobs including changes to CRON jobs

Operational Information or documentation to be detailed:
Instructions to run/call jobs/endpoints
New flows and dependancies
New End points
Symptoms of failure at front end, logging information etc.
Methods to recover/restart
Link to updated architectural docs
Link to updated operational support docs}
